alert.note: Alert for Eastern Douglas County Foothills; Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 30 at 1:31AM PDT until April 03 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT ABOVE 2500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 2500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 18 inches possible. * WHERE...Eastern Douglas County Foothills and Jackson County Cascades Foothills, including Butte Falls and Prospect. This includes highways 62, and 140. * WHEN...From Friday evening through late Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Heavy snow could result in difficult and hazardous travel conditions. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Stock emergency kit with tire chains, flashlight, batteries, blankets, food, water, and medications. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * Plan now to avoid traveling during the storm. * A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may create dangerous travel.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Douglas County Foothills; Jackson County
